examples:
OPTIONS /resource/foo
Access-Control-Request-Method: DELETE
Access-Control-Request-Headers: origin, x-requested-with
Origin: https://foo.bar.org

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Length: 0
Connection: keep-alive
Access-Control-Allow-Origin: https://foo.bar.org
Access-Control-Allow-Methods: POST, GET, OPTIONS, DELETE
Access-Control-Max-Age: 86400

Accept-Charset: iso-8859-1

Accept-Charset: utf-8, iso-8859-1;q=0.5

Accept-Charset: utf-8, iso-8859-1;q=0.5, *;q=0.1

Accept-Encoding: gzip

Accept-Encoding: gzip, compress, br

Accept-Encoding: br;q=1.0, gzip;q=0.8, *;q=0.1

Accept-Language: de

Accept-Language: de-CH

Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5

Accept-Patch: application/example, text/example

Accept-Patch: text/example;charset=utf-8

Accept-Patch: application/merge-patch+json

syntax: The directives are case-insensitive and have an optional argument, that can use both token and quoted-string syntax. Multiple directives are comma-separated.
As a response header for the main body
examples:
200 OK
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="cool.html"
Content-Length: 21

<HTML>Save me!</HTML>

POST /test.html HTTP/1.1
Host: example.org
Content-Type: multipart/form-data;boundary="boundary"

--boundary
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="field1"

value1
--boundary
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="field2"; filename="example.txt"

value2
--boundary--

<!-- /!\ This is bad practice -->
<meta http-equiv="content-language" content="de">

PUT /new/post Host: example.com Content-Type: text/markdown # My first blog post! I made this through `example.com`'s API. I hope it worked. HTTP/1.1 201 Created Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8 Content-Location: /my-first-blog-post ✅ Success!

HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8 Content-Location: /my-receipts/38 (Lots of HTML…)

You sent $38.00 to ExampleUser.

(Lots more HTML…)

<form action="/" method="post" enctype="multipart/form-data">
  <input type="text" name="description" value="some text">
  <input type="file" name="myFile">
  <button type="submit">Submit</button>
</form>
POST /foo HTTP/1.1
Content-Length: 68137
Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=---------------------------974767299852498929531610575

-----------------------------974767299852498929531610575
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="description" 

some text
-----------------------------974767299852498929531610575
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="myFile"; filename="foo.txt" 
Content-Type: text/plain 

(content of the uploaded file foo.txt)
-----------------------------974767299852498929531610575--

syntax: No other expectations except "100-continue" are specified currently.
examples:
PUT /somewhere/fun HTTP/1.1
Host: origin.example.com
Content-Type: video/h264
Content-Length: 1234567890987
Expect: 100-continue

Forwarded: for="_mdn" 

# case insensitive
Forwarded: For="[2001:db8:cafe::17]:4711"

# separated by semicolon
Forwarded: for=192.0.2.60;proto=http;by=203.0.113.43

# multiple values can be appended using a comma
Forwarded: for=192.0.2.43, for=198.51.100.17
X-Forwarded-For: 123.34.567.89
Forwarded: for=123.34.567.89

X-Forwarded-For: 192.0.2.43, 2001:db8:cafe::17
Forwarded: for=192.0.2.43, for="[2001:db8:cafe::17]"

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Connection: Keep-Alive
Content-Encoding: gzip
Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
Date: Thu, 11 Aug 2016 15:23:13 GMT

syntax: There are three possible directives for X-Frame-Options:
examples:
Header always set X-Frame-Options "sameorigin"
Header set X-Frame-Options "deny"
Header set X-Frame-Options "allow-from https://example.com/"
add_header X-Frame-Options sameorigin always;
<system.webServer>
  ...

  <httpProtocol>
    <customHeaders>
      <add name="X-Frame-Options" value="sameorigin" />
    </customHeaders>
  </httpProtocol>

  ...
</system.webServer>
rspadd X-Frame-Options:\ sameorigin
http-response set-header X-Frame-Options sameorigin
const helmet = require('helmet');
const app = express();
app.use(helmet.frameguard({ action: "sameorigin" }));
const frameguard = require('frameguard')
app.use(frameguard({ action: 'sameorigin' }))
